india.name: India
india.climate: Tropical to temperate; varies by region
india.speciality: Diverse culture, heritage sites, festivals, and cuisine
india.culture: A tapestry of traditions, religions, and festivals with millennia of history and vibrant arts.

essentialTips.title: Cards & ATMs
essentialTips.note: Cards widely accepted in cities; cash for rural areas.

essentialTips.title: Cash
essentialTips.note: Withdraw INR from ATMs; keep small notes for markets.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Dress modestly at religious sites; remove shoes when required.

essentialTips.title: Age Laws
essentialTips.note: Legal drinking age varies by state (18–25).

faqs.q: How long does an Indian visa take?
faqs.a: E‑Visas typically process within 3–7 working days; timings can vary.
Oct–Mar is ideal for most regions; the Himalayas are best Apr–Jun.
7–12 days for a highlight trip; 14+ days for broader coverage.
Butter chicken, biryani, dosa, chaat, and regional specialties.
Hindi and English widely used; many regional languages.
INR; tip 5–10% at restaurants, small tips for porters/driver.
Hinduism, Islam, Christianity, Sikhism; Taj Mahal, Jaipur, Kerala, Varanasi.

japan.name: Japan
japan.speciality: Blend of tradition and technology, impeccable service
japan.culture: Deep traditions, tea ceremonies, shrines, and culinary excellence.

essentialTips.title: Cards
essentialTips.note: Cards accepted; carry cash for small shops.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Queue politely; avoid loud calls on public transit.

essentialTips.title: Drinking Age
essentialTips.note: 20 years.

faqs.a: Typically 5–10 working days for many nationalities.
Spring and autumn for mild weather and scenery.

thailand.name: Thailand
thailand.speciality: Beach escapes, temples, and warm hospitality
thailand.culture: Buddhist heritage, street food culture, island life.

essentialTips.title: Cards & Cash
essentialTips.note: ATMs common; many vendors prefer cash.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: A friendly wai (greeting) goes a long way.

faqs.a: Many nationalities get visa-on-arrival; check latest rules.
Nov–Feb for most regions.

indonesia.name: Indonesia
indonesia.speciality: Island nation with beaches, temples, volcanoes, and rich culture
indonesia.culture: A diverse archipelago of 17,000+ islands blending traditions, arts, and cuisines.

essentialTips.title: Cards & Cash
essentialTips.note: Cards accepted in tourist areas; carry IDR cash for markets.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Dress modestly at temples; be respectful of local customs.

essentialTips.title: Temple Visits
essentialTips.note: Sarongs may be required; rentals often available.

faqs.a: Apr–Oct (dry season) is ideal for most islands; check local microclimates.
Many nationalities can obtain a visa on arrival. Check the latest regulations.

china.name: China
china.climate: Varied: temperate, subtropical, arid, and alpine
china.speciality: Ancient civilization, Great Wall, diverse cuisine
china.culture: Rich history, festivals, calligraphy, and tea culture.

essentialTips.title: Cards & Cash
essentialTips.note: Mobile payments are common; cash still used in rural areas.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Respect elders; avoid sensitive topics in conversation.

faqs.a: Most visitors need a visa; check with the Chinese consulate.
Spring and autumn for most regions.

south_korea.name: South Korea
south_korea.culture: Modern meets tradition, vibrant pop culture, festivals.

essentialTips.title: Cards
essentialTips.note: Cards widely accepted; T-money card for transit.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Bow when greeting; use both hands to give/receive.

faqs.a: Many nationalities get visa-free entry; check latest rules.
Spring and autumn for mild weather and cherry blossoms.

vietnam.name: Vietnam
vietnam.climate: Tropical in south, monsoonal in north
vietnam.culture: Blend of Southeast Asian, Chinese, and French influences.

essentialTips.title: Cards & Cash
essentialTips.note: Cash is king; cards accepted in hotels and big cities.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Dress modestly at temples; remove shoes indoors.

faqs.a: E-visa available for many; check official site.
Spring and autumn for most regions.

malaysia.name: Malaysia
malaysia.culture: Fusion of Malay, Chinese, Indian, and indigenous cultures.

essentialTips.title: Cards & Cash
essentialTips.note: Cards accepted in cities; cash for markets and taxis.

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Remove shoes before entering homes and some buildings.

faqs.a: Many nationalities get visa-free entry; check official site.
Dry season (Mar–Oct) is best for most regions.

singapore.name: Singapore
singapore.speciality: Modern city-state, food paradise, efficient transport

essentialTips.title: Cards & Cash
essentialTips.note: Cards widely accepted; cash for hawker centers.

essentialTips.title: Laws
essentialTips.note: Strict rules on littering, chewing gum, jaywalking.

faqs.a: Many nationalities get visa-free entry; check official site.
Feb–Apr for pleasant weather and festivals.

nepal.name: Nepal

essentialTips.title: Etiquette
essentialTips.note: Remove shoes before entering homes and temples.

faqs.a: Visa on arrival for most; check official site.
